name: Mediterranean Bacon (Crockpot)
instructions: Prep: Season the bacon with salt, pepper, and spices. Place into the slow cooker.
Combine: Add aromatics and 1/2 cup broth or sauce; toss to coat.
Cook: Cover and cook on LOW 4–6 hours (or HIGH half the time) until fork‑tender.
Finish: Shred or slice if needed; stir back into juices and adjust seasoning.
Serve: Ladle into bowls or over rice with sides.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Sesame Ginger Bacon (Stove Top)
instructions: Prep: Pat the bacon dry; season both sides with salt and pepper. Mix spices with oil in a small cup.
Sear: Heat a large skillet over medium‑high; add oil. Sear bacon 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Cook: Reduce heat to medium; add seasonings/aromatics and cook, tossing, until done (about 10 minutes total).
Finish: Off heat, rest 2 minutes. Splash of citrus or herbs optional.
Serve: Plate with sides and pan juices spooned over.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Smoky Paprika Bacon (Stove Top)
instructions: Prep: Pat the bacon dry; season both sides with salt and pepper. Mix spices with oil in a small cup.
Sear: Heat a large skillet over medium‑high; add oil. Sear bacon 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Cook: Reduce heat to medium; add seasonings/aromatics and cook, tossing, until done (about 25 minutes total).
Finish: Off heat, rest 2 minutes. Splash of citrus or herbs optional.
Serve: Plate with sides and pan juices spooned over.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Cajun Black Beans (Instant Pot)
instructions: Prep: Season the black beans with salt, pepper, and spices.
Sauté: Set Instant Pot to Sauté; add oil and briefly brown black beans on both sides.
Pressure cook: Add liquids/sauce. Seal and cook at High Pressure for 10 minutes. Natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Finish: Reduce with Sauté if needed; adjust seasoning.
Serve: Plate with sides.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Chipotle Lime Black Beans (Stove Top)
instructions: Prep: Pat the black beans dry; season both sides with salt and pepper. Mix spices with oil in a small cup.

Cook: Reduce heat to medium; add seasonings/aromatics and cook, tossing, until done (about 25 minutes total).
Finish: Off heat, rest 2 minutes. Splash of citrus or herbs optional.
Serve: Plate with sides and pan juices spooned over.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Coconut Curry Black Beans (No Cook)
instructions: Prep: Drain/rinse components as needed; chop veggies and herbs.
Mix: In a bowl, whisk dressing or seasonings with oil and acid; add the black beans and toss gently to combine.
Adjust: Season to taste with salt, pepper, and citrus.
Chill: Refrigerate 10–15 minutes if time allows for flavors to meld.
Serve: Portion into bowls/plates and add sides.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Creamy Parmesan Black Beans (No Cook)

name: Honey Mustard Black Beans (Oven Bake)
instructions: Prep: Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil for easy cleanup.
Mix: In a bowl, stir oil with seasonings, salt, and pepper; add black beans and toss to coat.
Bake: Arrange in a single layer and bake about 25 minutes, flipping once if needed, until cooked through.
Finish: Let rest 2–3 minutes; garnish with fresh herbs or lemon if desired.

name: Tomato Basil Black Beans (Grill)
instructions: Prep: Pat the black beans dry. In a bowl, whisk oil with seasonings, salt, and pepper; toss to coat evenly.
Preheat grill to medium‑high (375–400°F). Clean and oil the grates.
Cook: Grill 4–6 minutes per side (thicker pieces may need longer) until nicely charred and cooked through.
Finish: Transfer to a plate and rest 3–5 minutes. Taste and adjust salt.
Serve: Spoon any resting juices over the black beans and plate with the sides.
notes: Adjust seasoning to taste. Verify doneness with a thermometer where applicable.

name: Chipotle Lime Canned Tuna (Air Fryer)
instructions: Prep: Preheat air fryer to 380–390°F. Pat the canned tuna dry; toss with oil, seasonings, salt, and pepper.
Cook: Arrange in a single layer in the basket. Air fry 22 minutes, flipping halfway, until cooked through and crisp at edges.
